member.name: M:RadiusCore.Areas.HelpPage.ObjectGenerator.GenerateObject(System.Type)
member.summary: Generates an object for a given type. The type needs to be public, have a public default constructor and settable public properties/fields. Currently it supports the following types: Simple types: , , , , , etc. Complex types: POCO types. Nullables: . Arrays: arrays of simple types or complex types. Key value pairs: Tuples: , , etc Dictionaries: or anything deriving from . Collections: , , , , , or anything deriving from or . Queryables: , .
member.returns: An object of the given type.

member.name: T:RadiusCore.Controllers.ObjectsController
member.summary: Objects are anything that is configurable for presentation. They generally have a parent child relationship with other Objects. Objects should represent real world items. An example is a well. The well may have meter, device, tank, compressor, and many other Objects as children. The well Object has properties (ObjectProperties) only associated with that well such as the well name, pipeline company, status, and other properties specific to a well. The meter Object will have properties only associated with the meter such as the meter ID and device meter ID. Itâ€™s important to note that an Object can be anything including houses, cars, or any other potential IoT Objects.

member.name: M:RadiusCore.Controllers.ObjectsController.Get(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a list of available Objects

member.name: M:RadiusCore.Controllers.ObjectsController.Post(RadiusCore.Models.ObjectModel)
member.summary: Update an Object. Along with the required variables you must also supply the ObjectID.

member.name: M:RadiusCore.Controllers.ObjectsController.Delete(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes an Object based on ID

member.name: T:RadiusCore.Controllers.SignalsController
member.summary: Signals operate off the concept that all PV's (process variables) can be reduced down to one thing. These are referred to as signals. A signal can represent any single IO or configuration point. Signals also recognize that a set point is treated the same as an IO point. Signals should have properties associated to identify features specific to the signal such as an column name or OPC tag.

member.name: M:RadiusCore.Controllers.SignalsController.Get
member.summary: Returns a list of available Signals

member.name: M:RadiusCore.Controllers.SignalsController.Get(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a Signal based on ID

member.name: M:RadiusCore.Controllers.SignalsController.Post(RadiusCore.Models.SignalModel)
member.summary: Update Signal. Along with the required variables you must also supply the SignalID. The History gets updated on every data change.

member.name: M:RadiusCore.Controllers.SignalsController.Delete(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes a Signal based on ID
